name: Homewood Suites University City

reviews.text: A great location right across the street from the west end of UPenn. Easy walk to all of campus. Hotel is only 5 months old, all new, smells/looks new& clean. Very large rooms, nice kitchen area, all modern.
reviews.title: Great Location at UPenn, Brand New Hotel

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Old School Charm; New School Feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice grocery store just one block away. Good for supplies.
reviews.title: Just great

reviews.text: Hotel has a few kinks to work out as a new building, gut the staff is doing well.
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay

reviews.text: Breakfast was so-so, trying to make too fancy (southwest eggs, quiche, etc), need to have "just plain eggs" each day as an option.
reviews.title: Wonderful! So clean & New!!!!!

reviews.text: Usually spend many hours reviewing different choices. This time, no choice on account of Hurricane Sandy. Needed a place to stay where there was heat and power. Called up Hilton toll free and went with what they had. And lucked out with a superb property.
reviews.title: Very pleasant surprise

reviews.text: Hotel is new and of course what's not to love about new. Very nice pool/hot tub set up -- very airy, high ceiling, skylight. Warm indoor pool. Same with the gym. Breakfast was good -- on par with Hampton Inn style (I consider them the "gold standard" of free breakfast providers). Staff very friendly and helpful. Special shout out to Chris at the Front Desk -- exceptionally friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are nice. Bed very comfy. The kitchenette set up is nicely done. Nice LCD TVs in the bedroom and living rooms.
reviews.title: Excellent Homewood Suites

reviews.text: Valet (no self parking) seemed a little pricely at $39/night -- maybe a little disrespectful of me to think that $39 is more of a New York / Boston / DC price level. Also 2 out of the 3 nights, only one valet attendant working so not particular fast -- he did try his best so not his fault.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: Area is generally safe although on the outer ring of "safe to walk alone at night" and was advised not to walk to far up Walnut St from where we were at night. Certainly not unsafe, just wanted to point out it's not "Old City" safe for those unfamiliar to Philly which I was.
reviews.title: Nice one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is great -- new, clean, with a helpful, friendly staff. The rooms are large and comfortable. The complementary breakfast offers a nice selection. The only downside (hence the 4 stars) is the location which is not within walking distance of center city and the historic areas. It is only a short subway ride away though with the subway stop 2 blocks away.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but not that convenient...

reviews.text: I needed a place to stay with my two girls for 6 weeks. My daughter was receiving treatment at the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia. I am so glad I picked this hotel. The staff were kind and friendly and went out of their way to make our stay the best. The shuttle drivers Darnell, Tyrez, and Tyrone took us to and from the hospital daily. They became our friends and driving each day was the highlight of our day. The food was excellent each day. Thanks so much to CJ, Stacey, April, Amanda, and Anna. They always stopped by our table to say hi. The housekeeping crew was excellent and made our room looked wonderful. Tanya was such a dear person always checking on us when we went to the swimming pool. At the front desk Chris, Shekel, Amanda were always professional. The managers Gary, Pat, and Irene made us feel like a welcomed guest each day. The valet Zach had such a friendly, positive attitude. The whole staff made our stay the absolute best from start to finish. I have never been treated so well in a hotel.
reviews.title: Treated like family

reviews.text: This is a very new and clean hotel with great amenities. The room was very nice; the fitness and business center were excellent; the breakfast and dinner were top notch.
reviews.title: What a Great Hotel and Exceptional staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, what is most important is the professionalism of the staff. They are courteous, professional and dedicated to their guests. Hats off to April and Amanda who have gone out of their way to ensure my stay was an enjoyable one.
reviews.title: Wonderful Gem in University City

reviews.text: I will definitely return to this hotel for future trips.
reviews.title: Wonderful property-will be back

reviews.text: This brand-spanking-new hotel in West Philadelphia at the heart of the UPenn campus is an outstanding option for individuals or families seeking more space and comfort than a traditional hotel room is capable of providing.
reviews.title: Excellent option in hotel-poor West Philadelphia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are clean and modern with very well-supplied kitchens, including full-sized fridge-freezers and dishwashers.
reviews.title: An amazing gem in University City

reviews.text: Beds are comfortable with white linens and nice pillows.
reviews.title: Perfect alternative to Sheraton or Hilton in University City

reviews.text: Hot breakfast is available seven days a week, and a hot dinner Monday-Thursday. Both are complimentary. I do think that the hotel could do a better job with the hot breakfast options -- higher-quality ingredients and more creative, healthier choices would be nice.
reviews.title: Really Great

reviews.text: All staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. At about the same price as the tired and rundown Sheraton in West Philadelphia, one would be crazy not to choose this hotel over the Sheraton.
reviews.title: Great stay at Homeward Suites

description: The suites in our brand-new University City property come in studio and one-bedroom sizes, all with top amenities and modern, attractive decor. Each suite includes a full kitchen with a refrigerator, microwave and twin-burner stove, and features separate living and sleeping areas with all the comforts of home and more.
